channel.title: Pricing on Zero Trust Analytics
channel.description: Recent content in Pricing on Zero Trust Analytics

item.title: For Developers: Our Pricing Model Beats Everyone (Unlimited Sites)
item.description:
Let me guess your situation:

  • Your portfolio site
  • That SaaS you’re building on the side
  • The client site you’re maintaining
  • Three abandoned projects you might resurrect
  • A blog that gets sporadic traffic
  • Landing pages for experiments

That’s 7+ sites. At $9-19 per site (Plausible, Fathom, etc.), you’re looking at $63-133/month just for basic analytics.

Or you could pay $15/month. Total. For all of them.

The Developer’s Analytics Problem

We know developers because we are developers. And we know the analytics struggle:

item.title: Why Agencies Are Switching to Unlimited-Site Analytics
item.description:
You manage 50 client websites. Each one needs analytics. Traditional pricing models make this expensive:

  • Google Analytics is “free” but creates compliance nightmares
  • Plausible charges per site ($9 Ã— 50 = $450/month)
  • Fathom charges per site with pageview limits
  • Most tools get expensive quickly at scale

There has to be a better way.

The Agency Analytics Problem

Marketing agencies have unique analytics needs:

Scale

  • Dozens or hundreds of client sites
  • New clients onboarding constantly
  • Varying traffic levels across sites
  • Need consistent reporting

Client Expectations

  • Clients want privacy-friendly options
  • GDPR/CCPA questions come up in sales calls
  • “What data are you collecting?” is a common concern
  • Cookie banners frustrate clients

Margin Pressure

  • Clients expect analytics as part of the package
  • Per-site costs eat into margins
  • Can’t easily pass costs through
  • Need predictable expenses

Traditional per-site pricing doesn’t work for this model.
